chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (4th w/in 5 yrs) was dismissed by the court.

  • Joshua R Christensen was found guilty of OWI (4th w/in 5 yrs), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: Discharge Hearing from Alcohol Treatment Court 12/15/16

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court, in custody, with attorney Nicholas Martinez.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.     State and staffing team motion for discharge.  Statement made by the defendant.  Defendant is formally discharged from ATC.

12/15/16: DEFENDANT DISCHARGED FROM ATC. DEFENDANT IS TO SERVE BALANCE OF ORIGINAL SENTENCE. PLUS IS ENTITLED TO ADDITIONAL CREDIT since released from Huber to ATC on 9/21/15 of: 33 days Sanctions and 135 days SCRAM/SCRAM-X
Defendant to pay: $50 per month commencing 1/15/17.

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court in custody with attorney James Henry Finn.  Melissa J. Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address the Defendant's discharge from the ATC program.  Attorney Finn addresses the Court.  The Defendant requests the court discharge Attorney Finn from the case.  The Court discharges Attorney Finn from the case.   The Court orders the Defendant be released from custody to attend the funeral for his grandmother.  The Court will hold a discharge hearing next week during ATC.  The Defendant is to be released forthwith and to is to report to WCS forthwith to be placed on SCRAM.  The Court orders the Defendant to be released no later than 5:30 p.m. today.   The Defendant is to report back to the Waukesha County Jail on Monday, December 12, 2016 at 9:00 a.m.   The Court  will appoint an attorney to represent the Defendant at the discharge hearing.

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court, in custody.  Kevin Michael Osborne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court calls the case to address status of counsel.    The Defendant advises the Court Attorney Finn no longer represents the Defendant and he has applied and does not qualify for representation by the public defender's office and requests the Court allow to be released to attend the funeral of his grandmother.   The Court will take up the Defendant's request with staffing at ATC and the Defendant will appear during ATC tomorrow, Thursday, December 8, 2016.
Review hearing on December 7, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court, in custody, with attorney James Finn.   Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Suha advises the Court that it will be providing reports to Attorney Finn and requests the Court hold the discharge hearing  next Thursday.  Attorney Finn is in agreement.  The Court will hold the discharge hearing  on  Thursday,  December 8, 2016 at 2:30 p.m. during ATC.    Defendant to remain in custody at the Waukesha County Jail.

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State motions for discharge from ATC.      Based on the Defendant's non-compliance the Defendant is remanded into custody and is to remain in custody at the Waukesha County Jail until the court addresses the motion for discharge which will be heard December 1, 2016.  The Defendant is allowed to make a phone call to contact his attorney.

records.addlTxt:
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 27, 2015 at 03:30 pm.
NO DOCUMENT IN FILE.

Defendant Joshua R Christensen in court with attorney Walter Arthur Piel.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Plea Questionnaire previously filed.   Defendant enters a guilty plea to Count 1.  Court finds defendant guilty. Ct. 2 dismissed and read-in. Ct. 3 dismissed by operation of law. 

Ct. 1:
- Total sentence: 5 years (Initial Confinement: 2 years, Extended Supervision: 3 years)  Stayed for 3 years Probation
- Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration 
- Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program. 
- 36 months Drivers License Revocation. 
- 36 months Ignition Interlock every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to defendant
- Attendance at the Victim Impact Panel meeting on August 19, 2015 or 20 days jail with Huber consecutive.
- Alcohol Assessment 
- Blood Test Reimbursement of $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forwarded to Town of Mukwonago Police Department - APPLY BAIL. 
- Fine totaling: $1519.00 - APPLY BAIL
- DNA Surcharge waived.
- Conditions of  Probation: AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety. Random U.A.'s..   Follow thru with any treatment/counseling recommended by Agent. No use or possession of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription. No drug paraphernalia. Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed; Inform Agent of all prescriptions. Maintain full-time employment and/or combination of schooling. No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e. bars, taverns, or liquor stores).    Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department. 
- Defendant to perform 100 hours of community service as a Condition of Probation.
- 270 days jail with huber Condition Time (nonworking hours) commencing FORTHWITH.  Non-working hours with standard release conditions. Last 30 days STAYED to be used at the Agents discretion. Huber/Straight time to be used at the Agents discretion. 
Defendant was remanded to the custody of the Sheriff to commence the sentence.
Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.

ALL MOTIONS MUST BE FILED NO LATER THAN 10 DAYS PRIOR TO JURY STATUS HEARING AND MUST BE APPLICABLE TO THE CASE (i.e. NO GENERIC MOTIONS).  A RESPONSE TO ANY MOTION MUST BE FILED TWO DAYS PRIOR TO JURY STATUS HEARING.  THE RESPONSE SHOULD IDENTIFY WHETHER THERE IS ANY OBJECTION TO THE MOTION AND, IF SO, THE SPECIFIC BASIS FOR  THE OBJECTION.  COUNSEL SHOULD MEET AND CONFER TO MAKE A JOINT SUBMISSION OF JURY INSTRUCTIONS, SPECIFICALLY NOTING ANY DISAGREEMENT, AND FILE THOSE WITH THE COURT THE DAY BEFORE THE JURY STATUS ALONG WITH A WITNESS LIST AND ESTIMATE OF THE LENGTH OF THE TRIAL.
